content: 1 loop off your knitting needle on to your hook single_crochet 1 through the loop repeat until you work through all loops xbl = crossed broomstick lace requires loops in multiples of 6 or 4 15 mm knitting needle suggested 1 fp pull up loops through the bl and add them to your knitting needle for more stability you can lock your loops by doing a blch and then adding your working loop to your knitting needle note locking your loops is highly suggested for this stitch 2 rp 1 remove your hook from your working loop bring 3 or 2 loops off your knitting needle on to your hook bring your working loop back on to your hook your working loop is now in front of 3 or 2 loops 2 bring 1 loop off your knitting needle on to your hook 1 single_crochet through the loop repeat this for the next 2 or 1 loops 3 remove your hook from your working loop and the 3 or 2 reserved loops bring your working loop back on to your hook so it is now behind your reserved loops single_crochet 1 through each reserved loop this will result in an x 4 repeat steps 2a-2c until you work through all loops crbl = chain ridged broomstick lace requires loops in multiples of 2 15 mm knitting needle suggested for first 2 and last 2 loops to minimize extra yarn at the ends of the stitch 20 mm knitting needle suggested for all other loops note if your knitting needle has a cap at the opposite end you will need to bring all loops off the needle in order to work step 1b of this stitch 1 fp a pull up loops through the bl and add them to your knitting needle for more stability you can lock your loops by doing a blch and then adding your working loop to your knitting needle note locking your loops is highly suggested for this stitch b move all loops to the opposite end of your knitting needle and bring 2 loops off your knitting needle on to your hook a larger hook is helpful for this step c bring the next 2 loops off your knitting needle on to your hook you will now have 4 loops on your hook pull the front 2 loops through the back 2 loops you will have 2 loops left on your hook the result will look like a large chain from the top repeat this step until you work through all loops 2 rp a bring the last 2 loops on to your hook single_crochet 2 through both loops b looking at the stitch from the top you ll see your chain put your hook through the bl of the chain single_crochet 2 through the bl of the chain repeat until you work through all chains bbl = braided broomstick lace requires loops in multiples of 3 20mm knitting needle suggested 1 fp a pull
